newsitem.title: USA: Duff & Phelps lowers AT&T senior debt rating.
newsitem.headline: Duff & Phelps lowers AT&T senior debt rating.

text.p: Duff & Phelps Credit Rating Co said it lowered the rating on AT&T Corp's senior debt to double-A from double-AA-plus.
The telecommunications company's commercial paper was reaffirmed at D-one-plus, Duff & Phelps said.

"The rating change reflects the expected reduction in historically high free cash flow levels at AT&T due to financing requirements for its new business initiatives along with an increasing level of business risk associated with the implementation of open competition in the long distance and local exchange telephony marketplace," Duff & Phelps said.
"The rating also acknowledges the company's growth position as the largest wireless operator in the United States," said the credit rating agency.
